alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued August 29 at 5:43PM EDT until August 30 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Major coastal flooding peaking at 2 to 2.5 feet above mean high tide. * WHERE...Lower Keys. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon, but especially during the Wednesday morning high tide. Coastal flood statements or advisories may need to be extended into Thursday or Friday. * IMPACTS...Roads may be impassable. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of King tides and strong southerly breezes, will result in coastal flooding across the Lower Keys, but especially the vulnerable Atlantic side neighborhoods of Key West. Peak water levels will reach a little over 2 feet above mean high tide. Observations from the vulnerable neighborhoods of Key West this morning confirm these peak water levels.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
